courses.title: Principles of Programming
courses.description: An introductory paper on the fundamentals of programming and computer science. The course covers variables, expressions, input and output, control structures, functions, simple data structures and modules â€“ these concepts are introduced and applied practically with Python.

courses.title: An Introduction to Practical Computing
courses.description: A practical introduction to computers, hardware and software fundamentals. The course covers a general overview of computing concepts, with a focus on web design, operating systems, history of the internet, basic programming concepts and the social impact of technology.

courses.title: Principles of Computer Science
courses.description: An extension course that carries forward the knowledge gained in CompSci101, with an emphasis on code etiquette through understanding the significance of code reability/efficiency and data structures. More complex programming concepts are introduced, such as arrays, recursion, lists, stacks, queues and hash tables.

courses.title: Computer Systems 1
courses.description: A paper that aims to explore computer and systems architecture that is used within modern day computing. The course attempts to look at the intermediary interface layer that is used to communicate between the computer hardware and software. Topics such as data representation, a history of computer architecture, logic circuits, assembly language programming and C programming syntax are covered.

courses.title: Algorithms and Data Structures
courses.description: An introductory course concerning the analysis of algorithm and data structures within computer science. The course covers topics such as time complexity, sorting and searching algorithms, graph optimisation and string matching techniques.

courses.title: Discrete Structures in Mathematics and Computer Science
courses.description: An introduction to logic, counting principles, mathematical induction, graphs, trees and algorithms. A more mathematical approach to some of the concepts covered in that of CompSci220, placing more of an emphasis on mathematical proofs and logic based thinking.

courses.title: Programming Techniques
courses.description: An introduction to object-oriented and concurrent programming. Through Java programming applications, fundamental skills in object-oriented software development, GUI programming and application-level multithreading are covered.

courses.title: Functional Programming and Distributed Services
courses.description: A specialised course around functional programming for data integration, distributed services and browser based applications, specifically; REST architectures, security, and performance. Coursework included web-application building, XML/JSON schema testing and pen-testing exercises.

courses.title: Operating Systems
courses.description: A paper designed for understanding the intricacies of operating systems from the perspective of both programmer and program designer. Topics such as distributed computing, embedded devices, virtual machines/virtualisation, efficiency and scalability and parallelisation.

courses.title: Human-computer Interaction
courses.description: A course designed at examining human behaviour and expectations, computer interfaces and the interaction between the two. Usability design principles and human centred design concepts are emphasised, exploring the ideas of those such as Don Norman, Jakob Nielsen and John Maeda concerning human experiences with technology.

courses.title: Machine Learning
courses.description: An introductory course on the basics of machine learning and its application within artificial intelligence. Topics included basic concepts such as data bias, overfitting/underfitting models, applications of ML algorithms on a problem and learning to accurately obtain and interpret the results.

courses.title: Computer Graphics and Image Processing
courses.description: An introduction to the fundamentals of image processing and computer graphics, useful for the analysis and processing of image data and for the reconstruction of realistic 3 dimensional model rendering. The course covered topics like graphics primitives, lighting and shading, texture mapping, ray tracing, character animation and curve and surface design. In addition, image processing fundamentals are presented such as image definition and representation, perception and colour models, grey level and colour enhancement, neighbourhood operations and filtering.
